text: The Pittsburg–Clarksville Covered Bridge (also known as the Bacon Road Bridge) is a wooden Paddleford truss bridge with added arches over the Connecticut River located between Pittsburg and Clarksville, New Hampshire. It was closed to traffic in 1981. The bridge is the northernmost covered bridge crossing the Connecticut River. == History == It was rehabilitated in 1974 at a cost of $6,700 which was shared by the towns of Pittsburg and Clarksville, and the state. == See also == * List of crossings of the Connecticut River ==References== == External links == * Category:Covered bridges in New Hampshire Category:Pittsburg, New Hampshire Category:Bridges over the Connecticut River Category:Bridges completed in 1876 Category:Wooden bridges in New Hampshire Category:Tourist attractions in Coos County, New Hampshire Category:Bridges in Coos County, New Hampshire Category:Road bridges in New Hampshire Category:Long truss bridges in the United States Category:1876 establishments in New Hampshire
